ðŸŒŸ otter-launcher | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Launching shell scripts, applications, or arbitrary commands via a customizable command-line interface.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Modularized prefixes for running commands â€¢ Fuzzy search and tab completion â€¢ Module-specific prehook and callback commands â€¢ Customizable shell or window manager for launching programs â€¢ URL encoding for web searching
ðŸ“– Summary: Otter-launcher is a command-line program that allows users to launch commands, applications, or scripts with custom prefixes and keyboard shortcuts. It supports fuzzy searching, tab completion, and customization options such as ASCII color codes and shell integration. This makes it ideal for keyboard-centric workflows and integration with window managers.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ scrntime | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Display daily screen time usage over a specified number of days, accounting for idle time
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Daily screen time tracking based on system reboot logs â€¢ Idle time subtraction from total screen time (optional) â€¢ Customizable visualization options â€¢ Integration with xprintidle, hypridle, or swayidle for idle time management
ðŸ“– Summary: scrntime is a command-line tool that calculates daily screen time by parsing system reboot logs. It optionally integrates with idle time trackers (xprintidle, hypridle, swayidle) to subtract idle periods, providing a more accurate screen time usage report. Users can customize the visualization of their screen time data.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ letta | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Building stateful LLM applications and agents
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Open source framework for building stateful LLM applications â€¢ Build stateful agents with advanced reasoning capabilities and transparent long-term memory â€¢ White box and model-agnostic â€¢ Agent Development Environment (ADE) â€¢ REST API
ðŸ“– Summary: Letta is an open-source framework for creating stateful LLM applications. It enables the development of agents with advanced reasoning and persistent memory, offering both Docker and pip installation options and a REST API for interaction. The framework is model-agnostic and designed for transparency.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ pyenv | Roff
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Switching between multiple versions of Python
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Change the global Python version on a per-user basis â€¢ Support for per-project Python versions â€¢ Override the Python version with an environment variable â€¢ Search for commands from multiple versions of Python at a time
ðŸ“– Summary: pyenv allows users to easily manage multiple Python versions. It supports global, per-project, and environment variable-based version selection, enabling seamless switching between different Python installations for various development needs. This is useful for testing across different Python versions or managing project-specific requirements.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ web2py | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Agile development of secure database-driven web applications
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Full-stack framework â€¢ Database-driven web applications â€¢ Python-based â€¢ Database Abstraction Layer (DAL) â€¢ Supports Python 3.9+
ðŸ“– Summary: web2py is a full-stack Python framework for building secure web applications. It features a Database Abstraction Layer (DAL) and is compatible with Python 3.9+. While not recommended for new projects, it shares design philosophy and components with its successor, py4web.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ serviceradar | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Distributed network monitoring system for infrastructure and services in constrained environments
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Real-time monitoring of internal services â€¢ Cloud-based alerting â€¢ SNMP polling â€¢ ICMP testing â€¢ Network scanning
ðŸ“– Summary: ServiceRadar is a distributed network monitoring system that provides real-time monitoring and cloud-based alerting. It supports various monitoring methods including SNMP, ICMP, and specialized checks for Dusk nodes. The system is designed for use in challenging environments with limited network access.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ MegaParse | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Parsing various document types (PDF, PowerPoint, Word, Excel, CSV, Text) with minimal information loss.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Versatile Parser â€¢ No Information Loss â€¢ Fast and Efficient â€¢ Wide File Compatibility â€¢ Open Source
ðŸ“– Summary: MegaParse is an open-source, versatile parser designed for efficient and accurate extraction of information from diverse document formats. It prioritizes minimal information loss and supports various file types including PDFs, PowerPoint presentations, and Word documents. MegaParse offers both command-line and API usage options.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ graftcp | C
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Redirecting TCP connections of a given program to SOCKS5 or HTTP proxies for network traffic routing and anonymization
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ TCP connection redirection to SOCKS5 or HTTP proxy â€¢ Uses ptrace(2) for hooking connect(2), enabling support for any program (unlike LD_PRELOAD-based solutions) â€¢ Offers command-line options for configuration and customization
ðŸ“– Summary: graftcp is a command-line tool that redirects TCP connections made by any program to SOCKS5 or HTTP proxies using ptrace(2). It supports various configuration options and installation methods, including systemd service integration. This allows users to route network traffic through proxies for applications that are not compatible with traditional proxy solutions.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
